references.formattedCitation: Hubert Cancik, Helmuth Schneider, Manfred Landfester, Christine F. Salazar, and Francis G. Gentry, eds. Brill’s New Pauly: Encyclopaedia of the Ancient World. Brill, 2015. https://referenceworks.brillonline.com/browse/brill-s-new-pauly.

connections.description: A fragmentary inscription, probably dating to the third century BCE, records a boundary dispute and arbitrated demarcation of territory between the Phanoteioi and the Steirioi. The inscription, possibly not in situ, was found between Phanoteus and Chaironeia (rather far from Stiris). It is unclear where the disputed territory was located.

connections.title: Stiris/Steiris

description: A city of Phocis on the Boeotian frontier. Substantive remains of the ancient walled city are visible on the height immediately south of modern Hagios Vlasios (Municipality of Livadia, Boeotia, Greece).
details: The Barrington Atlas Directory notes: Ag. Vlasios
